page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT IN CHIRNSIDE
page.content: There are 2 grain stores at Craigswalls near Chirnside. There they store wheat, barley, oilseed rape and peas for farmers from Northumbria and the Borders. Grain can be stored for between 6 and 11 months in the 12 sheds. The most important visitor to the stores has been the Queen who was most impressed. Sixty thousand tons of grain can be stored at any one time. In the future there will be more sheds built to cater for an increased demand for the grain storing facilities. Outside Chirnside there is a very busy sawmill. Wood for the sawmill comes from forests in the south-east of Scotland and north-east England. Once at the sawmill, the wood is cut and treated by a special process and then goes to be used for pallets and fencing.
